climbs.name: Voodoo
climbs.fa: Paul Duval and Karen Hargrave Summer 2003

content.description: Thin moves and some nice crystals on steep face to the top of the East summit. Right bolt line from midway anchors.
content.protection: Bolts. Anchors on the top. Midway anchors placed to help ensure you get down without a snagged rope. USE A 60M ROPE OR LONGER!
content.location: Second pitch.  Right bolt line from midway anchors on East summit.

content.description:
This was never finished as Paul Duval passed away before we could return to finish this.

 If someone has the inclination, it is ripe for picking!  Have at it!
content.protection: Anchors on top of West summit and could be setup to TR this route.  Bring webbing as I don't recall leaving chain or links.

climbs.name: Resurrection
climbs.fa: Paul Duval, Karen Hargrave and Kevin Dorsman, Summer 2003

content.description: Bolt line near center of the face that negotiates a small roof half way up this pitch.  Anchors are located in the middle of the face half way up (as Paul Duval passed away and we never finished the upper section).
content.protection: Bolts.  Anchors midway up the face and will need sling as they are just hangers.
content.location: Uphill side of Prodigal Son on the face leading to West Summit. The start is left and downhill of the high point on the crest of the hill side.

climbs.name: Repent Now!
climbs.fa: Paul Duval and Kevin Dorsman  Summer 2003

content.description: Scramble up easy rocks to the main mass and follow the right bolt line.  The first bolt is high for short climbers and my require slinging the flake to cool the nerves...but it's all there.  The route moves up and right and eventually back left to the ledge. Rap from anchors on the ledge, or continue up other options to either summit. If I remember correctly, there are 5 bolts???
content.protection: Bolts, Anchor on the ledge, or continue to the top via various other routes.
content.location: Uphill side of Prodigal Son near the high point/crest of the hill.

content.description: Right to Left rising crack located on the main wall just right of the arete that holds The End is Near.  Standard Needles rack.
content.protection: Standard Needles rack. When the ledge is reached you can build an anchor or move up to anchors above the terminus of the crack before rappelling to the base, or continue to the top.
content.location: Uphill side of Prodigal Son.  From the high point on the hillside, move right and down hill just past the flake to the right to left rising crack.

climbs.name: Gospel According to John
climbs.fa: John Biddick, Paul Duval and Karen Hargrave, Summer 2003

content.description: Second pitch. Left bolt line from midway anchors on the main wall of the East summit.
content.protection: Bolts. Anchors on the top. Midway anchors placed to help ensure you get down without a snagged rope. USE A 60M ROPE OR LONGER!
content.location: Second pitch on the uphill side of Prodigal Son accessed from any routes starting at the high point/crest of the hillside.

climbs.name: Fatted Calf
climbs.fa: Kevin Dorsman and Emily Peck, Summer 2003

content.description: Scramble up easy rocks/flake to the main mass and follow the left bolt line. Rap from anchors on the ledge, or continue up other options to either summit. If I remember correctly, there are 4 bolts???
content.protection: Bolts, anchors on the ledge that bring you back almost on top of your packs...or continue up several options to the top.
content.location: On the uphill side of Prodigal Son, near the high point at the crest of the hill.

climbs.name: The End is Near
climbs.fa: Paul Duval and Karen Hargrave Summer 2003

content.description: Starts on the arete and follows it to the ledge.  Exciting and keeps you on your toes...literally.
content.protection: Bolts, rap anchors on the ledge or continue to the top of either summit.
content.location: Uphill side of Prodigal Sun, right and 20' downhill from from Repent Now!  Follows the arete to the ledge.

climbs.name: Conn Route/Southern Comfort (P1) Whiskey Fist Fight (P2)
climbs.fa: Herb and Jan Conn/ Adrian Hahn and Randy Trewhella 1998

content.description:
First of all, I believe this is the Conn route and am only adding this as it was in the register.  Hopefully we can gain clarity for historical purposes.

 Pitch 1, or Southern Comfort is located left of Fatted Calf and goes up the crack with the piton.  This could be P1 of the Conn Route, or it is possible the Conns came up behind this, between the main wall and the flake that holds The End is Near.  

 Pitch 2, or Whiskey Fist Fight, is definitely the Conn's second pitch and follows the obvious crack/chimney/cleft up between the two summits.  Exit to either summit.
content.location: Uphill side of Prodigal Son at the high point/crest of the hill side.  Scramble up flake/rocks to the crack that leads to the ledge.

climbs.name: Conn Route
climbs.fa: Herb and Jan Conn and Bill Gilson 10/02/1958

content.description: Follows up The backside of the formation. Top is a "Off-width" Style Crack and quite awkward at that.
content.protection: standard Rack Cord and Slings help get you down.

climbs.name: Banshee
climbs.fa: Paul Duval, Karen Hargrave and Kevin Dorsman, Summer 2003

content.description: Second pitch.  Wide crack that leads up to the West summit from the ledge. Widish, ricey and blue-collar.
content.protection: Standard Needles rack. Maybe a 4 BD Cam would be nice?
content.location: Second pitch. From the ledge, move up following Conn's P2 and break left into the wide crack.

content.description: On the SE Toe of the formation just before heading up the uphill side of Prodigal Son is a bolt 20' up.  Paul Duval recalled that it may have been a Muehl route but no other information is known.  Provided here to reference hand drawn map.  5.9 is only a guess as MP will not let me proceed without a rating.  Proceed as you wish.
content.protection: Standard Needles rack and a few draws???
content.location: SE Toe of main formation on uphill side of Prodigal Son.

content.description: Prodigal Son is an obvious spire when driving down SD HWY 87 South towards Sylvan lake Lodge. This spire is hard to miss. Just pass the campground before the switchbacks. Easy way to access now. There are 3 obvious gravel turnoffs go to the 3rd one when heading towards Sylvan lake pull into here. Drive all the way up to an open area and park. Minor hike in gets you to the base. There are 4 Other routes on and around this formation. 3 being extremely well bolted. All with new anchors. 2 trad climbs one that climbs to a bolt then some gear in a bulge to an anchor. The other is a nice horizontal crack that leads to a new set up SS chain anchors on the backside. Any info would be great!
